intro: Pilea luisiana, commonly known as the Mexican stone plant, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Urticaceae and is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit. The plant features heart-shaped, glossy leaves with a waxy coating, and it produces small, inconspicuous greenish-white flowers. It is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its attractive foliage and ease of care. Pilea luisiana prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil.
